{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Driver and Admin Assistant",
  "description": "MSI Nigeria Reproductive Choices is a result-oriented social enterprise, which uses modern management and marketing techniques to provide reproductive health care and allied services.MSI Nigeria&rsquo;s goal is to meet the needs of underserved Nigerians and dramatically improve access and use of a range of reproductive health services.MSI Nigeria Reproductive Choices is part of Marie Stopes International&rsquo;s Global Partnership which is in over 37 countries worldwide and it operates in Nigeria through six service delivery channels.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Driver and Admin Assistant
Job Location:&nbsp;Cross River
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	The Driver/Admin Assistant at MSI Nigeria plays a crucial role in ensuring the safe transportation of personnel, maintaining vehicle quality, and assisting with administrative tasks.


Key Responsibilities
Your responsibilities as a DAA shall include;


	Maintaining a high level of professionalism in driving assigned persons at all times
	To ensure that MSI Nigeria Reproductive Choices always attains high standard quality care of vehicles
	To ensure that vehicles are always in good working conditions
	To report all damages to the Regional Administrative Officer and the Logistics &amp; Fleet Management Sub-Unit for necessary action
	To channel all requests for repairs, maintenance, and fuel through the Regional Administrative Officer and the Logistics &amp; Fleet Management Sub-Unit
	To ensure that all keys are safely kept in the key rag
	To run project vehicle/s as appointed by the Regional Manager/Logistics &amp; Fleet Management Sub-Unit
	To keep daily record of vehicle
	To collect weekly itinerary from the Logistics &amp; Fleet Management Sub-Unit
	To return all vehicles to office immediately after approved usage
	Maintain a logbook: distance covered, fuel purchase, departure and arrival time
	Record service delivery data on CLIC
	Collecting, recording and reconciliation of cash on outreach site visits
	To operate assigned project vehicles in the line with MSI Nigeria Reproductive Choices Global Fleet Policy
	To perform other administrative duties as may be assigned.


Key Experience / Qualification


	Holder of a clean and valid driver&rsquo;s licence
	Up to a Degree in any discipline but not lower than an Ordinary National Diploma (OND) or its equivalent certificate
	Minimum of 4 years&rsquo; cognate experience as driver
	Experience driving operational vehicle such as Toyota Hilux will be an advantage
	Good knowledge of Nigerian driving rules and regulations including road signs and markings
	Experience working with INGO or organisation within the development sector will be an advantage.
	Must be computer literate (As role entails data entry using computer-based applications)
	Ability to read and write in the English Language
	Knowledge of the terrain and road network in the respective location
	Good communication skills
	Proficiency in speaking applicable local Language(s)
	Capacity to work as a team member.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their comprehensive Resume with a brief Cover Letter as one MS Word document or PDF to:&nbsp;msngrecruitment@msichoices.org.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the mail.

Note


	Specify the Position and the Location of interest in the Subject Line of your application, if you want your application to be considered.
	If the underline instructions are not followed application will not be considered.
	There are no relocation allowances available for this position.
	This role is open until filled and we will be conducting Interviews on a rolling basis even while the advertisement is still active.
	MSI Nigeria Reproductive Choices provides equal opportunity in employment and prohibits discrimination in employment on the basis of race, sex, colour, religion, age, marital status, or disability.
	MSI Nigeria is committed to safeguarding children and vulnerable adults and operates a zero-tolerance approach to abuse, exploitation, and harassment of any kind.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-08-22",
  "validThrough": "2025-08-29",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "MSI Nigeria Reproductive Choices"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Cross River",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "186235"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",

      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Driver and Admin Assistant Job at MSI Nigeria Reproductive Choices




        
    

        
        MSI Nigeria Reproductive Choices is a result-oriented social enterprise, which uses modern management and marketing techniques to provide reproductive health care and allied services.MSI Nigeria’s goal is to meet the needs of underserved Nigerians and dramatically improve access and use of a range of reproductive health services.MSI Nigeria Reproductive Choices is part of Marie Stopes International’s Global Partnership which is in over 37 countries worldwide and it operates in Nigeria through six service delivery channels.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Driver and Admin Assistant
Job Location: Cross River
Employment Type: Full-time
     

            
    



Job Description


	The Driver/Admin Assistant at MSI Nigeria plays a crucial role in ensuring the safe transportation of personnel, maintaining vehicle quality, and assisting with administrative tasks.


Key Responsibilities
Your responsibilities as a DAA shall include;


	Maintaining a high level of professionalism in driving assigned persons at all times
	To ensure that MSI Nigeria Reproductive Choices always attains high standard quality care of vehicles
	To ensure that vehicles are always in good working conditions
	To report all damages to the Regional Administrative Officer and the Logistics & Fleet Management Sub-Unit for necessary action
	To channel all requests for repairs, maintenance, and fuel through the Regional Administrative Officer and the Logistics & Fleet Management Sub-Unit
	To ensure that all keys are safely kept in the key rag
	To run project vehicle/s as appointed by the Regional Manager/Logistics & Fleet Management Sub-Unit
	To keep daily record of vehicle
	To collect weekly itinerary from the Logistics & Fleet Management Sub-Unit
	To return all vehicles to office immediately after approved usage
	Maintain a logbook: distance covered, fuel purchase, departure and arrival time
	Record service delivery data on CLIC
	Collecting, recording and reconciliation of cash on outreach site visits
	To operate assigned project vehicles in the line with MSI Nigeria Reproductive Choices Global Fleet Policy
	To perform other administrative duties as may be assigned.


Key Experience / Qualification


	Holder of a clean and valid driver’s licence
	Up to a Degree in any discipline but not lower than an Ordinary National Diploma (OND) or its equivalent certificate
	Minimum of 4 years’ cognate experience as driver
	Experience driving operational vehicle such as Toyota Hilux will be an advantage
	Good knowledge of Nigerian driving rules and regulations including road signs and markings
	Experience working with INGO or organisation within the development sector will be an advantage.
	Must be computer literate (As role entails data entry using computer-based applications)
	Ability to read and write in the English Language
	Knowledge of the terrain and road network in the respective location
	Good communication skills
	Proficiency in speaking applicable local Language(s)
	Capacity to work as a team member.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their comprehensive Resume with a brief Cover Letter as one MS Word document or PDF to: msngrecruitment@msichoices.org.ng using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the mail.

Note


	Specify the Position and the Location of interest in the Subject Line of your application, if you want your application to be considered.
	If the underline instructions are not followed application will not be considered.
	There are no relocation allowances available for this position.
	This role is open until filled and we will be conducting Interviews on a rolling basis even while the advertisement is still active.
	MSI Nigeria Reproductive Choices provides equal opportunity in employment and prohibits discrimination in employment on the basis of race, sex, colour, religion, age, marital status, or disability.
	MSI Nigeria is committed to safeguarding children and vulnerable adults and operates a zero-tolerance approach to abuse, exploitation, and harassment of any kind.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "title": "Administrative Assistant",
  "description": "Dovers Dental Clinic - We utilise the finest resources, skills, and innovations to bring out your best smile and overall health in the most relaxing and creative atmosphere!

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Assistant

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Manage front desk operations: patient check-ins, appointment scheduling, and inquiries
	Maintain accurate patient records and assist with billing and payment processes
	Coordinate staff meetings and maintain office supplies
	Prepare reports, documentation, and handle correspondence professionally
	Manage and update the clinic&rsquo;s social media pages (Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn)
	Create engaging content (photos, short captions, stories) to promote services and special offers
	Respond to online inquiries and direct messages promptly
	Assist with basic online marketing campaigns and community engagement
	Track social media performance and report growth metrics.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;clinic@doversdental.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Administrative Assistant Job at Dovers Dental Clinic




        
    

        
        Dovers Dental Clinic - We utilise the finest resources, skills, and innovations to bring out your best smile and overall health in the most relaxing and creative atmosphere!

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Assistant

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Manage front desk operations: patient check-ins, appointment scheduling, and inquiries
	Maintain accurate patient records and assist with billing and payment processes
	Coordinate staff meetings and maintain office supplies
	Prepare reports, documentation, and handle correspondence professionally
	Manage and update the clinic’s social media pages (Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn)
	Create engaging content (photos, short captions, stories) to promote services and special offers
	Respond to online inquiries and direct messages promptly
	Assist with basic online marketing campaigns and community engagement
	Track social media performance and report growth metrics.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: clinic@doversdental.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Inventory Officer",
  "description": "CEO&#39;s Mart is a retail business located in Eleganza, Lekki, Lagos. It typically offers a wide range of products, including groceries, household items, and personal care products. The store aims to provide quality goods at competitive prices while ensuring a pleasant shopping experience for customers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Description


	We are seeking a detail-oriented Inventory Officer to manage inventory operations and develop strategies to optimize stock management.
	The ideal candidate will ensure accurate inventory records, enhance operational efficiency, and contribute to the overall success of the business.


Job Responsibilities


	Oversee daily inventory operations, including stock receiving, storage, and distribution.
	Maintain accurate inventory records and conduct regular stock audits to ensure data integrity.
	Develop and implement inventory management strategies to minimize waste and optimize stock levels.
	Collaborate with purchasing and sales teams to forecast inventory needs and manage replenishment.
	Analyze inventory data to identify trends, shortages, and opportunities for improvement.
	Champion initiatives to enhance inventory processes, including the use of technology and best practices.
	Ensure compliance with health and safety regulations and organizational policies.
	Prepare regular reports on inventory performance and present findings to management.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Proven experience in inventory management or a related role.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Excellent attention to detail and organizational abilities.
	Proficiency in inventory management software and Microsoft Office applications.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


Benefits


	Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.
	Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
	Employee discounts and other benefits.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hr.recruitmentnigeria23@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Inventory Officer Job at CEO's Mart




        
    

        
        CEO's Mart is a retail business located in Eleganza, Lekki, Lagos. It typically offers a wide range of products, including groceries, household items, and personal care products. The store aims to provide quality goods at competitive prices while ensuring a pleasant shopping experience for customers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory Officer
Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Description
     

            
    




	We are seeking a detail-oriented Inventory Officer to manage inventory operations and develop strategies to optimize stock management.
	The ideal candidate will ensure accurate inventory records, enhance operational efficiency, and contribute to the overall success of the business.


Job Responsibilities


	Oversee daily inventory operations, including stock receiving, storage, and distribution.
	Maintain accurate inventory records and conduct regular stock audits to ensure data integrity.
	Develop and implement inventory management strategies to minimize waste and optimize stock levels.
	Collaborate with purchasing and sales teams to forecast inventory needs and manage replenishment.
	Analyze inventory data to identify trends, shortages, and opportunities for improvement.
	Champion initiatives to enhance inventory processes, including the use of technology and best practices.
	Ensure compliance with health and safety regulations and organizational policies.
	Prepare regular reports on inventory performance and present findings to management.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Proven experience in inventory management or a related role.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Excellent attention to detail and organizational abilities.
	Proficiency in inventory management software and Microsoft Office applications.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


Benefits


	Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.
	Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
	Employee discounts and other benefits.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr.recruitmentnigeria23@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

We offer comprehensive human resources and advisory services that help businesses scale, streamline operations, and maximize workforce performance.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Inflight Entertainment Engineer",
  "description": "At Air Peace Limited, we continuously strive for excellence in all we do. Through our people we are able to attain higher heights because their unique strengths and experiences help us turn challenges into opportunities. We employ the best talent and provide a great opportunity and environment for them to display their best skills in a service driven environment.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Inflight Entertainment Engineer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Role&nbsp;Description


	To plan, execute, and certify inspections, repairs, replacements, modifications, installations, and software/content updates for aircraft Inflight Entertainment (IFE) systems, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements, company standards, and OEM specifications.
	The role also involves supervising technicians, managing documentation, liaising with vendors/OEMs, and driving continuous improvement to maximize IFE system availability and passenger satisfaction.


Key Responsibilities
Maintenance &amp; Repair:


	Plan, assign, and carry out inspections, fault isolation, troubleshooting, repair, replacement, and modification tasks on aircraft IFE systems.
	Rectify and certify IFE defects within the limitations of company and regulatory approvals.
	Perform software/content uploads, system configuration, and version control in line with OEM and regulatory requirements.
	Utilize Built-In Test Equipment (BITE) data to diagnose and resolve faults.


Installation &amp; Modification:


	Support installation or retrofit of IFE systems, including wiring, equipment mounting, and integration tasks.
	Coordinate with OEMs and vendors during installation, modification, and upgrade projects.


Documentation &amp; Compliance:


	Develop, review, and revise engineering documents such as task cards,
	AMM/IPC references, CMM updates, and modification work packs.
	Maintain accurate aircraft records and ensure all maintenance actions are documented and signed off.
	Monitor and implement applicable Service Bulletins (SBs),
	Airworthiness Directives (ADs), and other mandatory requirements.
	Ensure all work is performed in compliance with NCAA, EASA, FAA, and company regulations.
	Supervision &amp; Resource Management
	Allocate daily work to technicians and monitor progress to ensure quality and efficiency.
	Identify and requisition required IFE spare parts, tools, and consumables.
	Train, mentor, and develop technicians to improve competency and troubleshooting skills.


Continuous Improvement:


	Identify reliability trends and propose corrective/preventive actions.
	Recommend procedural and technical improvements for system
	performance and maintenance efficiency.
	Liaise with internal departments, OEMs, and vendors to address
	persistent issues and support product enhancement.


Safety &amp; Reporting:


	Promote a safe working environment in compliance with company
	Safety Management System (SMS) policies.
	Report all incidents, accidents, and near-misses in accordance with company reporting procedures.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	95% IFE system availability fleet-wide.
	All IFE defects rectified within agreed turnaround times.
	First-time fix rate above target threshold.
	Closure of passenger-related IFE reports (OT Is) within 72 hours.
	Zero regulatory findings in IFE-related audits.
	Reduction in repetitive IFE defects through trend analysis and preventive actions.
	On-time and accurate completion of maintenance records.


Requirements
Education &amp; Certification:


	Diploma or Bachelor&#39;s Degree in Electrical / Electronic, Avionics, Aerospace, or related Engineering discipline.
	Vendor training on specific aircraft IFE systems (e.g., Panasonic, Thales, Safran, Collins) is required.
	Basic Aircraft Maintenance License (Bl/B2) or equivalent is an added advantage.





Experience:


	Minimum of 7 years of aircraft maintenance experience, with at least 3 years in IFE maintenance or engineering.
	Experience in both line and base maintenance environments, including IFE installations and retrofits.


Soft Skills:


	Leadership and team management abilities.
	Strong interpersonal and vendor liaison skills.
	Analytical thinking and problem-solving mindset.
	Customer service orientation with focus on passenger experience.


Technical Skills:


	Strong understanding of IFE systems architecture, hardware, and software integration.
	Ability to interpret and apply AMM, IPC, CMM, SBs, and ADs.
	Proficiency with MRO software systems (e.g., TRAX, AMOS) and common office applications.
	Knowledge of regulatory requirements (NCAA, EASA, FAA) and industrial safety standards.
	Advanced troubleshooting and fault isolation skills, including use of
	BITE tools and test equipment.


Competencies:


	Integrity, transparency, and accountability.
	Ability to handle multiple priorities without compromising quality.
	Effective leadership and mentorship.
	Strong communication and collaboration skills across departments and with vendors.
	Flexibility to work irregular hours, weekends, and on-call duties as required.
	Commitment to safety, compliance, and continuous improvement.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;careers@flyairpeace.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2025-08-22",
  "validThrough": "2025-09-06",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Air Peace Limited"
    
  },

Inflight Entertainment Engineer Job at Air Peace Limited




        
    

        
        At Air Peace Limited, we continuously strive for excellence in all we do. Through our people we are able to attain higher heights because their unique strengths and experiences help us turn challenges into opportunities. We employ the best talent and provide a great opportunity and environment for them to display their best skills in a service driven environment.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inflight Entertainment Engineer

Job Location: Lagos

Role Description
     

            
    




	To plan, execute, and certify inspections, repairs, replacements, modifications, installations, and software/content updates for aircraft Inflight Entertainment (IFE) systems, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements, company standards, and OEM specifications.
	The role also involves supervising technicians, managing documentation, liaising with vendors/OEMs, and driving continuous improvement to maximize IFE system availability and passenger satisfaction.


Key Responsibilities
Maintenance & Repair:


	Plan, assign, and carry out inspections, fault isolation, troubleshooting, repair, replacement, and modification tasks on aircraft IFE systems.
	Rectify and certify IFE defects within the limitations of company and regulatory approvals.
	Perform software/content uploads, system configuration, and version control in line with OEM and regulatory requirements.
	Utilize Built-In Test Equipment (BITE) data to diagnose and resolve faults.


Installation & Modification:


	Support installation or retrofit of IFE systems, including wiring, equipment mounting, and integration tasks.
	Coordinate with OEMs and vendors during installation, modification, and upgrade projects.


Documentation & Compliance:


	Develop, review, and revise engineering documents such as task cards,
	AMM/IPC references, CMM updates, and modification work packs.
	Maintain accurate aircraft records and ensure all maintenance actions are documented and signed off.
	Monitor and implement applicable Service Bulletins (SBs),
	Airworthiness Directives (ADs), and other mandatory requirements.
	Ensure all work is performed in compliance with NCAA, EASA, FAA, and company regulations.
	Supervision & Resource Management
	Allocate daily work to technicians and monitor progress to ensure quality and efficiency.
	Identify and requisition required IFE spare parts, tools, and consumables.
	Train, mentor, and develop technicians to improve competency and troubleshooting skills.


Continuous Improvement:


	Identify reliability trends and propose corrective/preventive actions.
	Recommend procedural and technical improvements for system
	performance and maintenance efficiency.
	Liaise with internal departments, OEMs, and vendors to address
	persistent issues and support product enhancement.


Safety & Reporting:


	Promote a safe working environment in compliance with company
	Safety Management System (SMS) policies.
	Report all incidents, accidents, and near-misses in accordance with company reporting procedures.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	95% IFE system availability fleet-wide.
	All IFE defects rectified within agreed turnaround times.
	First-time fix rate above target threshold.
	Closure of passenger-related IFE reports (OT Is) within 72 hours.
	Zero regulatory findings in IFE-related audits.
	Reduction in repetitive IFE defects through trend analysis and preventive actions.
	On-time and accurate completion of maintenance records.


Requirements
Education & Certification:


	Diploma or Bachelor's Degree in Electrical / Electronic, Avionics, Aerospace, or related Engineering discipline.
	Vendor training on specific aircraft IFE systems (e.g., Panasonic, Thales, Safran, Collins) is required.
	Basic Aircraft Maintenance License (Bl/B2) or equivalent is an added advantage.





Experience:


	Minimum of 7 years of aircraft maintenance experience, with at least 3 years in IFE maintenance or engineering.
	Experience in both line and base maintenance environments, including IFE installations and retrofits.


Soft Skills:


	Leadership and team management abilities.
	Strong interpersonal and vendor liaison skills.
	Analytical thinking and problem-solving mindset.
	Customer service orientation with focus on passenger experience.


Technical Skills:


	Strong understanding of IFE systems architecture, hardware, and software integration.
	Ability to interpret and apply AMM, IPC, CMM, SBs, and ADs.
	Proficiency with MRO software systems (e.g., TRAX, AMOS) and common office applications.
	Knowledge of regulatory requirements (NCAA, EASA, FAA) and industrial safety standards.
	Advanced troubleshooting and fault isolation skills, including use of
	BITE tools and test equipment.


Competencies:


	Integrity, transparency, and accountability.
	Ability to handle multiple priorities without compromising quality.
	Effective leadership and mentorship.
	Strong communication and collaboration skills across departments and with vendors.
	Flexibility to work irregular hours, weekends, and on-call duties as required.
	Commitment to safety, compliance, and continuous improvement.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@flyairpeace.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
